gurmukhi: ੴ> ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ||
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Onkaar,the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ੧ ਮੰਗਲਾਚਰਨ, ਗੁਰੂ
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Onkaar,the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿ ਰੂਪ ਗੁਰੁ ਦਰਸਨੋ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਅਚਰਜੁ ਦਿਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sati Roop Guru Darasano Pooran Brahamu Acharaju Dikhaaiaa.
translation: The glimpse of the Guru (Nanak Dev) is in the form of truth which has brought me face to face with the perfect and wondrous

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਨਾਮੁ ਕਰਤਾ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮੁ ਪਰਮੇਸਰੁ ਧਿਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sati Naamu Karataa Purakhu Paarabrahamu Paramaysaru Dhiaaiaa.
translation: Bestowing upon the people the mantra of true Name and the creator Lord, he has made the people remember the transcendent B

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਗਿਅਾਨੁ ਸਚੁ ਅਨਹਦ ਧੁਨਿ ਵਿਸਮਾਦੁ ਸੁਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Satigur Sabad Giaanu Sachu Anahad Dhouni Visamaad Sounaaiaa.
translation: The knowledge of truth is the Word of the Guru, through which the wonder inspiring unstruck melody is heard.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥੁ ਚਲਾੲਿਓਨੁ ਨਾਮੁ ਦਾਨੁ ੲਿਸਨਾਨੁ ਦ੍ਰਿੜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Pandu Chalaaiaonu Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Drirhaaiaa.
translation: Initiating the gurmukh-panth, (Sikhism, the highway for gurmukhs) the Guru inspired one and all to be steadfastly absorbed

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਦੇ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਕਰਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਚੁਖੰਡੁ ਵਸਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikhu Day Gurasikh Kari Saadhasangati Sachu Khandu Vasaaiaa.
translation: Educating the people and making them his disciples, the Gum has founded holy congregation, the abode of truth.

gurmukhi: ਸਚੁ ਰਾਸਿ ਰਹਰਾਸਿ ਦੇ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਦੇ ਪੈਰੀ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sachu Raas Raharaasi Day Satigur Gurasikh Pairee Paaiaa.
translation: Handing over the capital of truth to the people, the Guru made them bow at the (lotus) feet (of the Lord).

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਪ੍ਰਤਾਪ ਜਣਾੲਿਅਾ ||੧||
transliteration: Charan Kaval Parataapu Janaaiaa ?1?
translation: He made people understand the glory of the feet (of the Lord).

gurmukhi: ੨ ਤੀਰਥ ਸਾਧੂ
translation: Pilgrimage centres and sadhus

gurmukhi: ਤੀਰਥ ਨ੍ਹਾਤੈ ਪਾਪ ਜਾਨਿ ਪਤਿਤ ੳੁਧਾਰਣ ਨਾੳੁ ਧਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Teerad Nhaatai Paap Jaani Patit Udhaaran Naaoun Dharaaiaa.
translation: Since the sins are obliterated at the pilgrimage centres, people have ven them the Name of uplifters of the fallen ones.

gurmukhi: ਤੀਰਥ ਹੋਨ ਸਕਾਰਥੇ ਸਾਧ ਜਨਾਂ ਦਾ ਦਰਸਨ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Teerad Hon Sakaaraday Saadh Janaan Daa Darasanu Paaiaa.
translation: But pilgrimage centres ecome meaningful only by the sight of the sadhus there.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧ ਹੋੲੇ ਮਨ ਸਾਧਿਕੈ ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਗੁਰ ਚਿਤਿ ਵਸਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Saadh Hoay Man Saadhi Kai Charan Kaval Gur Chiti Vasaaiaa.
translation: Sadhus are they, ho having disciplined the mind have put it in the lotus feet of the Guru. ory of sadhu is unfathomable and

gurmukhi: ੳੁਪਮਾ ਸਾਧ ਅਗਾਧਿ ਬੋਧ ਕੋਟ ਮਧੇ ਕੋ ਸਾਧੁ ਸੁਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Oupamaa Saadh Agaadhi Bodh Kot Madhay Ko Saadhu Sounaaiaa.
translation: One out of crores may be d to be a (true) sadhu.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸਾਧ ਅਸੰਖ ਜਗਿ ਧਰਮਸਾਲ ਥਾੲਿ ਥਾੲਿ ਸੁਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gurasikh Saadh Asankh Jagi Dharamasaal Daai Daai Suhaaiaa.
translation: However sadhus in the form of the Sikhs of Guru anak) are innumerable because the dharamscias, holy centres, flourish erywh

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਪੈਰ ਧੋਵਣੇ ਚਰਣੋਦਕੁ ਲੈ ਪੈਰੁ ਪੁਜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Pairee Pai Pair Dhovanay Charanodaku Lai Pairu Pujaaiaa.
translation: People bowing at the feet of the Sikhs of the Guru take wash ectar of their feet and worship the same.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲਿਅਾ ||੨||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Alakhu Lakhaaiaa ?2?
translation: Gurmukh has had the glimpse the imperceptible Lord and pleasure fruit there of.

gurmukhi: ੩ ਧੂੜੀ
translation: Dust

gurmukhi: ਪੰਜਿ ਤਤ ੳੁਤਪਤਿ ਕਰ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਧਰਤੀ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Panji Tat Outapati Kari Guramoukhi Dharatee Aapu Gavaaiaa.
translation: Cultivating the virtues of all the five elements in their hearts, the gurmukhs like earth have lost the sense of ego.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਸਰਣਾਗਤੀ ਸਭ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਸਭੇ ਫਲ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Charan Kaval Saranaagatee Sabh Nidhaan Sabhay Phal Paaiaa.
translation: They have come to the shelter of the Guru's feet and from that store - house they get all sorts of benefits.

gurmukhi: ਲੋਕ ਵੇਦ ਗੁਰ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਾਧੂ ਧੂੜਿ ਜਗਤੁ ਤਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Lok Vayd Gur Giaan Vichi Saadhoo Dhoorhi Jagat Taraaiaa.
translation: From convention and the knowledge given by the Guru also the same (conclusion) emerges that the dust of the (feet of) sadh

gurmukhi: ਪਤਿਤ ਪੁਨੀਤ ਕਰਾੲਿਕੈ ਪਾਵਨ ਪੁਰਖ ਪਵਿਤ੍ਰ ਕਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Patit Pouneet Karaai Kai Paavan Purakh Pavitr Karaaiaa.
translation: The fallen ones are made meritorious and the meritorious ones are further transformed into sacred ones.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣੋਦਕ ਮਹਿਮਾ ਅਮਿਤ ਸੇਖ ਸਹਸ ਮੁਖਿ ਅੰਤੁ ਨ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Charanodak Mahimaa Amit Saykh Sahas Moukhi Antu N Paaiaa.
translation: The glory of the wash nectar of the feet of sadhus is limitless; even Stesanag (thouosand hooded mythological snake) while

gurmukhi: ਧੂੜੀ ਲੇਖੁ ਮਿਟਾੲਿਅਾ ਚਰਣੋਦਕ ਮਨੁ ਵਸਿਗਤਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dhoorhee Laykhu Mitaaiaa Charanodak Manu Vasigati Aaiaa.
translation: Eulogizing the Lord by its many a mouth could not know it. The dust of sadhu's feet has erased all debts and because of that feet-wash nectar, the mind has also come under control.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਜਗੁ ਚਰਨੀ ਲਾੲਿਅਾ ||੩||
transliteration: Pairee Pai Jagu Charanee Laaiaa ?3?
translation: Gurmukh first himself bowed at the feet and then he made the whole world fall at his feet.

gurmukhi: ੪ ਗੰਗਾ ਦੇ ਦ੍ਰਿਸ਼ਟਾਂਤ ਤੋਂ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ਼
translation: Teachings from the example of Ganges

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣੋਦਕੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਸੁਰਸਰੀ ਤਜਿ ਬੈਕੁੰਠ ਧਰਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Charanodaku Hoi Surasaree Taji Baikountd Dharati Vichi Aaee.
translation: Ganges, the wash of the Lords' feet, left heavens and came down to arth.

gurmukhi: ਨੳੁ ਸੈ ਨਦੀ ਨੜਿੰਨਵੈ ਅਠਸਠਿ ਤੀਰਥਿ ਅੰਗਿ ਸਮਾੲੀ
transliteration: Nau Sai Nadee Narhinnavai Atdasatdi Teeradi Angi Samaaee.
translation: Nine hundred ninety nine rivers and sixty eight pilgrimage centres erged in it.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਹੁ ਲੋੲੀ ਪਰਵਾਣੁ ਹੈ ਮਹਾਦੇਵ ਲੈ ਸੀਸ ਚੜ੍ਹਾੲੀ
transliteration: Tihu Loee Paravaanu Hai Mahaadayv Lai Sees Charhhaaee.
translation: In all the three worlds, it is accepted as authentic and Mahadev ,iva) has borne it on his head.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵੀ ਦੇਵ ਸਰੇਵਦੇ ਜੈ ਜੈ ਕਾਰ ਵਡੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Dayvee Dayv Sarayvaday Jai Jai Kaar Vadee Vadiaaee.
translation: Gods and goddesses all worship it and hail s greatness.

gurmukhi: ਸਣੁ ਗੰਗਾ ਬੈਕੁੰਠ ਲਖ ਲਖ ਬੈਕੁੰਠ ਨਾਥਿ ਲਿਵ ਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Sanu Gangaa Baikountd Lakh Lakh Baikountd Naadi Liv Laaee.
translation: Myriads of heavens and the master of heavens including the ranges, absorbed in meditation declare,

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧੂ ਧੂੜਿ ਦੁਲੰਭ ਹੈ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸਰਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Saadhoo Dhoorhi Dulabh Hai Saadhasangati Satiguru Saranaaee.
translation: That the dust of the feet of sadhu is rare and is obtainable only by coming under the shelter of the true Guru.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਦਲ ਕੀਮ ਨ ਪਾੲੀ ||੪||
transliteration: Charan Kaval Dal Keem N Paaee ?4?
translation: Value of even the one petal of the lotus feet is beyond assessment.

gurmukhi: ੫ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਾਂ ਦੇ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਦੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ
translation: Grandeur of the pleasure -fruit of gurmukhs

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਸਰਣਿ ਜਿਸੁ ਲਖਮੀ ਲਖ ਕਲਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਲਖੀ ਨ ਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Charan Sarani Jisu Lakhamee Lakh Kalaa Hoi Lakhee N Jaaee.
translation: Lakhs of invisible powers adorn the shelter of the feet of goddess of wealth (Laksmi);

gurmukhi: ਰਿਧਿ ਸਿਧਿ ਨਿਧਿ ਸਭ ਗੋਲੀਅਾਂ ਸਾਧਿਕ ਸਿਧ ਰਹੇ ਲਪਟਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ridhi Sidhi Nidhi Sabh Goleeaan Saadhik Sidh Rahay Lapataaee.
translation: All prosperities, miraculous powers and treasures are her servants and many an accomplished person is engrossed in her.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਵਰਨ ਛਿਅ ਦਰਸਨਾ ਜਤੀ ਸਤੀ ਨੳੁ ਨਾਥ ਨਿਵਾੲੀ
transliteration: Chaari Varan Chhia Darasanaan Jatee Satee Nau Naad Nivaaee.
translation: All the four vamas, six philosophies, celebates, suttees and nine maths have been made to bow by her.

gurmukhi: ਤਿੰਨ ਲੋਅ ਚੌਦਹ ਭਵਨ ਜਲਿ ਥਲਿ ਮਹੀਅਲ ਛਲੁ ਕਰਿ ਛਾੲੀ
transliteration: Tinn Loa Chaudah Bhavan Jali Dali Maheeal Chhalu Kari Chhaaee.
translation: Deceptively she is pervading all the three worlds, fourteen abodes, land, sea and the nether worlds.

gurmukhi: ਕਵਲਾਸਣੁ ਕਵਲਾਪਤੀ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਰਣਾਗਤਿ ਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Kavalaa Sanu Kavalaapatee Saadhasangati Saranaagati Aaee.
translation: That goddess Kamala (Laksmi) alongwith her husband (Visnu) seeks the shelter of holy congregation

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਪਾਖਾਕ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲਿ ਨ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਣਾੲੀ
transliteration: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Aapu Gavaai N Aapu Ganaaee.
translation: Wherein the gurmukhs bowing at the feet of holy persons have lost their ego and still have kept themselves unnoticed.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਵਡੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ ||੫||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Vadee Vadiaaee ?5?
translation: The grandeur of the pleasure-fruit of the gurmukhs is very great.

gurmukhi: ੬ ਬਲਿ ਤੋਂ ਚਰਨ ਕਮਲਾਂ ਦੀ ਮਹਿਮਾਂ
translation: Grandeur of the lotus feet in context with king Bali story

gurmukhi: ਬਾਵਨ ਰੂਪੀ ਹੋੲਿ ਕੈ ਬਲਿ ਛਲਿ ਅਛਲਿ ਅਾਪੁ ਛਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Baavan Roopee Hoi Kai Bali Chhali Achhali Aapu Chhalaaiaa.
translation: Assuming the form of Vaman (short statured brahmin) and remaining unsuccessful in beguiling king Bali

gurmukhi: ਕਰੋਂ ਅਢਾੲੀ ਧਰਤਿ ਮੰਗਿ ਪਿਛੋ ਦੇ ਵਡ ਪਿੰਡੁ ਵਧਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Karaoun Addhaaee Dharati Mangi Pichhon Day Vad Pindu Vadhaaiaa.
translation: He Himself got beguiled. Having asked for two and a half steps of land, Vaman, afterwards enlarged His body.

gurmukhi: ਦੁੲਿ ਕਰੁਵਾ ਕਰਿ ਤਿੰਨਿ ਲੋਅ ਬਲਿ ਰਾਜੇ ਫਿਰਿ ਮਗਰੁ ਮਿਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dui Karuvaa Kari Tinni Loa Bali Raajay Dhiri Magaru Minaaiaa.
translation: In two steps He measured all the three worlds and in a half step He measured the body of king Bali.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਰਗਹੁ ਚੰਗਾ ਜਾਣਿ ਕੈ ਰਾਜੁ ਪਤਾਲ ਲੋਕ ਦਾ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Suragahu Changaa Jaani Kai Raaju Pataal Lok Daa Paaiaa.
translation: Accepting the kingdom of netherworld better than heavens Bali started ruling it.

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਹਮਾ ਬਿਸਨੁ ਮਹੇਸੁ ਤ੍ਰੈ ਭਗਤ ਵਛਲ ਦਰਵਾਨ ਸਦਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Brahamaa Bisanu Mahaysu Trai Bhagati Vachhal Daravaan Sadaaiaa.
translation: Now the Lord, in whom subsume Brahma, Visnu and Mahen, becoming lover of His devotees, served as a door keeper of king Bali

gurmukhi: ਬਾਵਨ ਲਖ ਸੁ ਪਾਵਨਾ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਰਜ ੲਿਛ ੲਿਛਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Baavan Lakh Su Paavanaa Saadhasangati Raj Ichh Ichhaaiaa.
translation: Many sacred incarnations like Vaman also have the wish of having the dust of the feet of holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਚਰਨ ਧਿਅਾੲਿਅਾ ||੬||
transliteration: Saadh Sangati Gur Charan Dhiaaiaa ?6?
translation: They also contemplate the feet of the Guru in the company of holy ones.

gurmukhi: ੭ ਪਰਸਰਾਮ ਅਵਤਾਰ
translation: Parsu Ram remained devoid of the delight of the lotus feet

gurmukhi: ਸਹਸ ਬਾਹੁ ਜਮਦਗਨਿ ਘਰਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਪਰਾਹੁਣਚਾਰੀ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sahas Baahu Jamadagani Ghari Hoi Paraahounachaaree Aaiaa.
translation: A king named Sahasrbahu came to Jamadagni rishi as a guest.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਮਧੇਣੁ ਲੋਭਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਜਮਦਗਨੈ ਦਾ ਸਿਰੁ ਵਢਵਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Kaamadhaynu Lobhaai Kai Jamadaganai Daa Siru Vaddhavaaiaa.
translation: Seeing wish-ful-filling cow with the rishi he became greedy and killed Jamdagni.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਟਦੀ ਸੁਣਿ ਕੈ ਰੇਣੁਕਾ ਪਰਸਰਾਮ ਧਾੲੀ ਕਰਿ ਧਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Pitadee Souni Kai Raynoukaa Parasaraam Dhaaee Kari Dhaaiaa.
translation: Hearing the wails of Renuka, his mother, Parana Ram came running to her.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕੀਹ ਵਾਰ ਕਰੋਧ ਕਰਿ ਖਤ੍ਰੀ ਮਾਰਿ ਨਿਖਤ੍ਰ ਗਵਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Ikeeh Vaar Karodh Kari Khatree Maari Nikhatr Gavaaiaa.
translation: Becoming full of anger he cleared this earth of the kshatriyas twenty-one time i.e. he killed all the kashatriyas.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਸਰਣਿ ਫੜਿ ੳੁਬਰੇ ਦੂਜੈ ਕਿਸੈ ਨ ਖੜਗੁ ੳੁਚਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Charan Sarani Dharhi Oubaray Doojai Kisai N Kharhagu Ouchaaiaa.
translation: Only those who fell at the feet of Parasu Rim were saved; none else could raise arms against him.

gurmukhi: ਹੳੁਮੈ ਮਾਰਿ ਨ ਸਕੀਅਾ ਚਿਰੰਜੀਵ ਹੁੲਿ ਅਾਪੁ ਜਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Haoumai Maari N Sakeeaa Chiranjeev Hui Aapu Janaaiaa.
translation: He also could not obliterate his ego and though he became chiraiijiv i.e. ever living person,

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਮਕਰੰਦੁ ਨ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ ||੭||
transliteration: Charan Kaval Makarandu N Paaiaa ?7?
translation: He always made show of his ego and could never receive the pollen of the lotus feet (of Lord).

gurmukhi: ੮ ਰਾਮ ਚੰਦ੍ਰ ਤੋਂ ਧੂੜੀ ਦਾ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ਼
translation: From Ramchandr teachings of dust of feet

gurmukhi: ਰੰਗ ਮਹਲ ਰੰਗ ਰਾਗ ਵਿਚਿ ਦਸਰਥੁ ਕੳੁਸਲਿਅਾ ਰਲੀਅਾਲੇ
transliteration: Rang Mahal Rang Rang Vichi Dasaradu Kaousaliaa Raleeaalay.
translation: In their pleasure palace, Daisarath and Kaus'alya were absorbed in their joys.

gurmukhi: ਮਤਾ ਮਤਾੲਿਨਿ ਅਾਪ ਵਿਚਿ ਚਾੲਿ ਚੲੀਲੇ ਖਰੇ ਸੁਖਾਲੇ
transliteration: Mataa Mataaini Aap Vichi Chaai Chaeelay Kharay Soukhaalay.
translation: In their exultations they were planning as to what should be the name of their son yet to be born.

gurmukhi: ਘਰਿ ਅਸਾੜੈ ਪੁਤੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਨਾੳੁ ਕਿ ਧਰੀਅੈ ਬਾਲਕ ਬਾਲੇ
transliteration: Ghari Asaarhai Poutu Hoi Naau Ki Dhareeai Baalak Baalay.
translation: They thought that the name should be Ram Chandr because just reciting the name of Ram

gurmukhi: ਰਾਮ ਚੰਦੁ ਨਾੳੁ ਲੈਂਦਿਅਾਂ ਤਿੰਨਿ ਹਤਿਅਾ ਤੇ ਹੋੲਿ ਨਿਰਾਲੇ
transliteration: Raam Chandu Naau Laindiaan Tinni Hatiaa Tay Hoi Niraalay.
translation: They would get rid of three killings (embroy and its parents murder).

gurmukhi: ਰਾਮ ਰਾਜ ਪਰਵਾਣ ਜਗਿ ਸਤ ਸੰਤੋਖ ਧਰਮ ਰਖਵਾਲੇ
transliteration: Raam Raaj Paravaan Jagi Sat Santokh Dharam Rakhavaalay.
translation: The Ram Rai (kingdom of Ram) in which truth, contentement and dharma were protected,

gurmukhi: ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਵਿਚਿ ੳੁਦਾਸ ਹੋੲਿ ਸੁਣੈ ਪੁਰਾਣੁ ਬਸਿਸਟੁ ਬਹਾਲੇ
transliteration: Maaiaa Vichi Udaas Hoi Sounai Puraanu Basisatu Bahaalay.
translation: Was acknowledged throughout the world. Rim remained detached from maya and sitting near Vasisth listened to the tales of th

gurmukhi: ਰਾਮਾੲਿਣੁ ਵਰਤਾੲਿਅਾ ਸਿਲਾ ਤਰੀ ਪਗ ਛੁਹਿ ਤਤਕਾਲੇ
transliteration: Raamaainu Varataaiaa Silaa Taree Pag Chhuhi Tatakaalay.
translation: Through the Rtimayatt people came to know that the stone (Ahalya) was restored to life by the touch of the feet of Rim.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਪਗ ਧੂੜਿ ਨਿਹਾਲੇ ||੮||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Pag Dhoorhi Nihaalay ?8?
translation: That Ram also fell happy to attain the dust of the congregations of the sadhus (and went to forest to wash the feet of anch

gurmukhi: ੯ ਕ੍ਰਿਸ਼ਨ ਚੰਦਾਵਤਾਰ
translation: Krsnachandravatar

gurmukhi: ਕਿਸਨ ਲੈ ਅਵਤਾਰੁ ਜਗਿ ਮਹਮਾ ਦਸਮ ਸਕੰਧੁ ਵਖਾਣੈ
transliteration: Kisan Laiaa Avataaru Jagi Mahamaa Dasam Sakandhu Vakhaanai.
translation: The tenth chapter of the Bhagavat defines the glory of incarnation of Krsna in the world.

gurmukhi: ਲੀਲਾ ਚਲਤ ਅਚਰਜ ਕਰਿ ਜੋਗੁ ਭੋਗ ਰਸ ਰਲੀਅਾ ਮਾਣੈ
transliteration: Leelaa Chalat Acharaj Kari Jogu Bhogu Ras Raleeaa Maanai.
translation: He performed many wonderful acts of bhog (merriment) and yoga (renunciation).

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾ ਭਾਰਥੁ ਕਰਵਾੲਿਓਨੁ ਕੈਰੋ ਪਾਂਡੋ ਕਰਿ ਹੈਰਾਣੈ
transliteration: Mahaa Bhaaradu Karavaaiaonu Kairo Paando Kari Hairaanai.
translation: Making Kauravs (sons of Dhrttrastr) and Pandays to fight against each other he further made them wonder struck.

gurmukhi: ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰਾਦਿਕ ਬ੍ਹਮਾਦਿਕਾ ਮਹਿਮਾ ਮਿਤਿ ਮਿਰਜਾਦ ਨ ਜਾਣੈ
transliteration: Indraadik Brahamaadikaa Mahimaa Miti Mirajaad N Jaanai.
translation: Indr and Brahma et al. donot know the limits of his grandeur.

gurmukhi: ਮਿਲੀਅਾ ਟਹਲਾ ਵੰਡਿ ਕੈ ਜਗਿ ਰਾਜਸੂ ਰਾਜੇ ਰਾਣੈ
transliteration: Mileeaa Tahalaa Vandi Kai Jagi Raajasoo Raajay Raanai.
translation: When Raisfiy was arranged by Yudhisthar, all were alloted their duties.

gurmukhi: ਮੰਗ ਲੲੀ ਹਰਿ ਟਹਲ ੲੇਹ ਪੈਰ ਧੋੲਿ ਚਰਣੋਦਕੁ ਮਾਣੈ
transliteration: Mang Laee Hari Tahal Ayh Pair Dhoi Charanodaku Maanai.
translation: Krsna himself tookover the duty of washing of the feet of all so that through this service

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦੁ ਸਿਞਞਞਞਾਣੈ ||੯||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Siaanai ?9?
translation: He could realise the importance of the service of the holy congregation and the Word of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ੧੦ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਸੁਲਭ, ਚਰਨ ਗੁਰ ਦੁਰਲੱਭ
translation: Invocation of Lord is easily available but the feet of Guru are rare ,

gurmukhi: ਮਛ ਰੂਪ ਅਵਤਾਰੁ ਧਰਿ ਪੁਰਖਾਰਥੁ ਕਰਿ ਵੇਦ ੳੁਧਾਰੇ
transliteration: Machh Roop Avataaru Dhari Purakhaaradu Kari Vayd Udhaaray.
translation: It is said that in the form of (great) fish Vista' incarnated himself and by his valour salvaged the Vedas.

gurmukhi: ਕਛੁ ਰੂਪ ਹੁੲਿ ਅਵਤਰੇ ਸਾਗਰੁ ਮਥਿ ਜਗਿ ਰਤਨ ਪਸਾਰੇ
transliteration: Kachhu Roop Hui Avataray Saagaru Madi Jagi Ratan Pasaaray.
translation: Then in the form of tortoise he churned the ocean and brought jewels out of it.

gurmukhi: ਤੀਜਾ ਕਰਿ ਬੈਰਾਹ ਰੂਪੁ ਧਰਤਿ ੳੁਧਾਰੀ ਦੈਤ ਸੰਘਾਰੇ
transliteration: Teejaa Kari Bairaah Roopu Dharati Udhaaree Dait Sanghaaray.
translation: In the form of third incarnation Virah, he decimated demons and liberated the earth.

gurmukhi: ਚੳੁਥਾ ਕਰਿ ਨਰਸਿੰਘ ਰੂਪੁ ਅਸੁਰੁ ਮਾਰਿ ਪ੍ਹਿਲਾਦਿ ੳੁਬਾਰੇ
transliteration: Chaudaa Kari Narasingh Roopu Asuru Maari Prahilaadi Oubaaray.
translation: In fourth incarnation he assumed the form of man-lion andeicilling demon (Hiranyakasipu) saved Prahalid.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਸੈ ਹੀ ਬ੍ਹਮੰਡ ਵਿਚਿ ਦਸ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਲੲੇ ਅਹੰਕਾਰੇ
transliteration: Ikasai Hee Brahamand Vichi Das Avataar Laay Ahankaaray.
translation: Incarnating ten times in this one world Vismi also became egotist.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਿ ਬ੍ਹਮੰਡ ਕਰੋੜਿ ਜਿਨਿ ਲੂੰਅ ਲੂੰਅ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸੰਜਾਰੇ
transliteration: Kari Brahamand Karorhi Jini Looa Looa Andari Sanjaaray.
translation: But, the Lord Oankar who has subsumed crores of worlds

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਕਰੋੜਿ ੲਿਵੇਹਿਅਾ ਓਅੰਕਾਰ ਅਕਾਰ ਸਵਾਰੇ
transliteration: Lakh Karorhi Ivayhiaa Aoankaar Akaar Savaaray.
translation: In His each trichome has managed myriads of such individuals.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਮਲ ਗੁਰ ਅਗਮ ਅਪਾਰੇ ||੧੦||
transliteration: Charan Kamal Gur Agam Apaaray ?10?
translation: Nevertheless, the lotus feet of Guru are unapproachable and beyond all limits.

gurmukhi: ੧੧ ਚਰਣ ਗੁਰ ਸਭ ਤੋਂ ਸ੍ਰੇਸ਼ਟ
translation: Feet of Guru are the best ones

gurmukhi: ਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਵੇਦ ਪੁਰਾਣ ਸਭ ਸੁਣਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਅਾਖਣੁ ਅਾਖਿ ਸੁਣਾਵਹਿ
transliteration: Saasatr Vayd Puraan Sabh Souni Souni Aakhanu Aakh Sounaavahi.
translation: Having listened to the Shastras, Vedas and Puranas people further recite and listen to them.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਗ ਨਾਦ ਸੰਗੀਤ ਲਖ ਅਨਹਦ ਧੁਨਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਗੁਣ ਗਾਵਹਿ
transliteration: Raag Naad Sangati Lakh Anahad Dhouni Souni Souni Goun Gaavahi.
translation: Millions of people listen to the rag-nod (musical measures)and the unstrucke melody and sing the same.

gurmukhi: ਸੇਖ ਨਾਗ ਲਖ ਲੋਮਸਾ ਅਬਿਗਤਿ ਗਤਿ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਲਿਵਲਾਵਹਿ
transliteration: Saykh Naag Lakh Lomasaa Abigati Gati Andari Liv Laavahi.
translation: SesanEg and millions of Lomas rishis concentrate to know the dynamism of that unmanifest Lord.

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਹਮੇ ਬਿਸਨੁ ਮਹੇਸ ਲਖ ਗਿਅਾਨੁ ਧਿਅਾਨੁ ਤਿਲੁ ਅੰਤੁ ਨ ਪਾਵਹਿ
transliteration: Brahamo Bisanu Mahays Lakh Giaanu Dhiaanu Tilu Antu N Paavahi.
translation: Millions of Brahma, Visnus and Sivas who concentrate upon and talk of Him, are still ignorant about even an iota of His mys

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵੀ ਦੇਵ ਸਰੇਵਦੇ ਅਲਖ ਅਭੇਵ ਨ ਸੇਵ ਪੁਜਾਵਹਿ
transliteration: Dayvee Dayv Sarayvaday Alakh Abhayv N Sayv Pujaavahi.
translation: Gods and goddesses adore that Lord but their service does not take them to His mystery.

gurmukhi: ਗੋਰਖ ਨਾਥ ਮਛੰਦ੍ਰ ਲਖ ਸਾਧਿਕ ਸਿਧਿ ਨੇਤ ਕਰਿ ਧਿਅਾਵਹਿ
transliteration: Gorakh Naad Machhandr Lakh Saadhik Sidhi Nayt Kari Dhiaavahi.
translation: Millions of Machhendr näths (Matsyendranath), Gorakhnaths and the siddhs (the ascetics of high orders) concentrate upon Him through their yogic practices (of dhautr and neti etc).

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਮਲ ਗੁਰੁ ਅਗਮ ਅਲਾਵਹਿ ||੧੧||
transliteration: Charan Kamal Guru Agam Alaavahi ?11?
translation: They all declare the feet of Guru as unapproachable

gurmukhi: ੧੨ ੳੂਚ ਅਾਦਰ ਯੋਗ ਨਹੀਂ
translation: The higher one is alone is not respectable

gurmukhi: ਮਥੈ ਤਿਵੜੀ ਬਾਮਣੈ ਸੳੁਹੇ ਅਾੲੇ ਮਸਲਤਿ ਫੇਰੀ
transliteration: Madai Tivarhee Baamanai Sauhay Aaay Masalati Dhayree.
translation: If going out doors one comes across a brahmin (who is proud of his high caste in India), the traditional people consider it

gurmukhi: ਸਿਰੁ ੳੁਚਾ ਅਹੰਕਾਰ ਕਰਿ ਵਲ ਦੇ ਪਗ ਵਲਾੲੇ ਡੇਰੀ
transliteration: Siru Ouchaa Ahankaar Kari Val Day Pag Valaaay Dayree.
translation: The head being proud of its high place is tied with turban.

gurmukhi: ਅਖੀਂ ਮੂਲਿ ਨ ਪੂਜੀਅਨਿ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਵੇਖਨਿ ਮੇਰੀ ਤੇਰੀ
transliteration: Akheen Mooli N Poojeeani Kari Kari Vaykhani Mayree Tayree.
translation: Eyes are also not adored because they see with the sense of duality.

gurmukhi: ਨਕੁ ਨ ਕੋੲੀ ਪੂਜਦਾ ਖਾੲਿ ਮਰੋੜੀ ਮਣੀ ਘਨੇਰੀ
transliteration: Naku N Koee Poojadaa Khaai Marorhee Manee Ghanayree.
translation: Nose is also not worshipped because on seeing a low person the nose is turned up to show disdain.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਚੇ ਕੰਨ ਨ ਪੂਜੀਅਨਿ ੳੁਸਤਤਿ ਨਿੰਦਾ ਭਲੀ ਭਲੇਰੀ
transliteration: Ouchay Kann N Poojeeani Ousatati Nidaa Bhalee Bhalayree.
translation: Though placed higher, the ears are also not worshipped because they listen to the eulogy as well as slander.

gurmukhi: ਬੋਲਹੁ ਜੀਭ ਨ ਪੂਜੀਅੈ ਰਸ ਕਸ ਬਹੁ ਚਖੀ ਦੰਦ ਘੇਰੀ
transliteration: Bolahu Jeebh N Poojeeai Ras Kas Bahu Chakhee Dandi Ghayree.
translation: Tongue is also not worshipped because it is also surrounded by teeth and tastes both edibles and inedibles.

gurmukhi: ਨੀਵੇ ਚਰਣ ਪੂਜ ਹਥ ਕੇਰੀ ||੧੨||
transliteration: Neevayn Charan Pooj Had Kayree ?12?
translation: Only because of being the lowest, the feet are touched with hands in worshipful reverence.

gurmukhi: ੧੩ ਬੱਕਰੀ ਦੇ ਅਲੰਕਾਰ ਤੋਂ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ਼
translation: Lesson from Goat

gurmukhi: ਹਸਤਿ ਅਖਾਜੁ ਗੁਮਾਨ ਕਰਿ ਸੀਹੁ ਸਤਾਣਾ ਕੋੲਿ ਨ ਖਾੲੀ
transliteration: Hasati Akhaaju Goumaan Kari Seehu Sataanaa Koi N Khaaee.
translation: The proud elephant is inedible and none eats the mighty lion.

gurmukhi: ਹੋੲਿ ਨਿਮਾਣੀ ਬਕਰੀ ਦੀਨ ਦੁਨੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Hoi Nimaanee Bakaree Deen Dounee Vadiaaee Paaee.
translation: Goat is humble and hence it is respected everywhere.

gurmukhi: ਮਰਣੈ ਪਰਣੈ ਮੰਨੀਅੈ ਜਗਿ ਭੋਗਿ ਪਰਵਾਣੁ ਕਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Maranai Paranai Manneeai Jagi Bhogi Paravaanu Karaaee.
translation: On occasions of death, joy, marriage, yajna, etc only its meat dis accepted.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਸੁ ਪਵਿਤ੍ਰ ਗ੍ਹਿਸਤ ਨੋ ਅਾਂਦਹੁ ਤਾਰ ਵੀਚਾਰਿ ਵਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Maasu Pavitr Grihasat No Aandahu Taar Veechaari Vajaaee.
translation: Among the householders its meat is acknowledged as sacred and with its gut stringed instruments are made.

gurmukhi: ਚਮੜੇ ਦੀਅਾ ਕਰਿ ਜੁਤੀਅਾ ਸਾਧੂ ਚਰਣ ਸਰਣਿ ਲਿਵਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Chamarhay Deeaan Kari Jouteeaa Saadhoo Charan Sarani Liv Laaee.
translation: From its leather the shoes are made to be used by the saints merged in their meditation upon the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਤੂਰ ਪਖਾਵਜ ਮੜੀਦੇ ਕੀਰਤਨੁ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸੁਖਦਾੲੀ
transliteration: Toor Pakhaavaj Marheeday Keeratanu Saadhasangati Soukhadaaee.
translation: Drums are mounted by its skin and then in the holy congregation the delight-giving kirtan, eulogy of the Lord, is sung.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਰਣਾੲੀ ||੧੩||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Satigur Saranaaee ?13?
translation: In fact, going to the holy congregation is the same as going to the shelter of the true Guru.

gurmukhi: ੧੪ ਮਾਣਸ ਦੇਹੀ
translation: Human body

gurmukhi: ਸਭ ਸਰੀਰ ਅਕਾਰਥੇ ਅਤਿ ਅਪਵਿਤ੍ਰ ਸੁ ਮਾਣਸ ਦੇਹੀ
transliteration: Sabh Sareer Sakaaraday Ati Apavitr Su Maanas Dayhee.
translation: All the bodies are useful but the human body is the most useless and defiled one.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁ ਬਿੰਜਨ ਮਿਸਟਾਨ ਪਾਨ ਹੁੲਿ ਮਲ ਮੂਤ੍ਰ ਕਸੂਤ੍ਰ ੲਿਵੇਹੀ
transliteration: Bahu Binjan Misataan Paan Hui Mal Mootr Kousootr Ivayhee.
translation: In its company many a delicious food, sweet etc change into urine and faeces.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਟ ਪਟੰਬਰ ਵਿਗੜਦੇ ਪਾਨ ਕਪੂਰ ਕੁਸੰਗ ਸਨੇਹੀ
transliteration: Paat Patanbar Vigarhaday Paan Kapoor Kousang Sanayhee.
translation: In its evil company silken robes, betel, comphor etc. also get spoiled.

gurmukhi: ਚੋਅਾ ਚੰਦਨੁ ਅਰਗਜਾ ਹੁੲਿ ਦੁਰਗੰਧ ਸੁਗੰਧ ਹੁਰੇਹੀ
transliteration: Choaa Chandanu Aragajaa Hui Duragandh Sougandh Hurayhee.
translation: Sandal scent, and joss sticks etc also get converted into fowl smell.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜੇ ਰਾਜ ਕਮਾਂਵਦੇ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹ ਖਹਿ ਮੁੲੇ ਸਭੇ ਹੀ
transliteration: Raajay Raaj Kamaanvaday Paatisaah Khahi Muay Sabhay Hee.
translation: Kings rule gheir kingdoms and die of their fights with one another.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਰਣਿ ਵਿਣੁ ਨਿਹਫਲ ਮਾਣਸ ਦੇਹ ੲਿਵੇਹੀ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Guru Sarani Vinu Nihaphalu Maanas Dayh Ivayhee.
translation: Withoug going to the holy congregation and to the shelter of Guru, this human body is also fruitless.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਨ ਸਰਣਿ ਮਸਕੀਨੀ ਜੇਹੀ ||੧੪||
transliteration: Charan Sarani Masakeenee Jayhee ?14?
translation: Only that body is meaningful which has come to the Guru's fold in humility

gurmukhi: ੧੫ ਭਗਤਾਂ ਦੇ ਨਾਮ
translation: Names of the devotees--bhagats

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰਸਰਣੀ ਅਾੲੇ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Paaiaa Saadhasangati Gur Saranee Aaay.
translation: Those gurmukhs who have gone into the shelter of the holy congretation have attained the pleasure fruit.

gurmukhi: ਧ੍ਰੂ ਪ੍ਹਿਲਾਦੁ ਵਖਾਣੀਅਨਿ ਅੰਬਰੀਕੁ ਬਲਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਸਬਾੲੇ
transliteration: Dhr Prahilaad Vakhaaneeani Anbareeku Bali Bhagati Sabaaay.
translation: These devotees are Dhruv, Prahalad, Ambaris, Bali, Janak, Jaidev, Valmilci et al.

gurmukhi: ਸਨਕਾਦਿਕ ਜੈਦੇੳੁ ਜਗਿ ਬਾਲਮੀਕੁ ਸਤਿਸੰਗ ਤਰਾੲੇ
transliteration: Janakaadik Jaidayu Jagi Baalameeku Satisangi Taraaay.
translation: They have gone across through the holy congregation. Bent, Trilochan, Namdev, Dhanna,

gurmukhi: ਬੇਣੁ ਤਿਲੋਚਨੁ ਨਾਮਦੇੳੁ ਧੰਨਾ ਸਧਨਾ ਭਗਤ ਸਦਾੲੇ
transliteration: Baynu Tilochanu Naamadayu Dhannaa Sadhanaa Bhagat Sadaaay.
translation: Sadhana have also been called saints. Kabir is accepted as bhagat, the devotee, and Ravidas,

gurmukhi: ਭਗਤੁ ਕਬੀਰ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਜਨ ਰਵਿਦਾਸੁ ਬਿਦਰ ਗੁਰੁ ਭਾੲੇ
transliteration: Bhagatu Kabeeru Vakhaaneeai Jan Ravidaasu Bidar Guru Bhaaay.
translation: Vidur et al. have also been loved by the Lord. Whether born in high or the low caste,

gurmukhi: ਜਾਤਿ ਅਜਾਤਿ ਸਨਾਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਚਿਤੁ ਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Jaati Ajaati Sanaati Vichi Guramoukhi Charan Kaval Chitu Laaay.
translation: The gurmukh who has adopted the lotus feet in his heart,

gurmukhi: ਹੳੁਮੈ ਮਾਰੀ ਪ੍ਰਗਟੀ ਅਾੲੇ ||੧੫||
transliteration: Haoumai Maaree Pragatee Aaay ?15?
translation: Decimating his ego has come to be known (as devotee).

gurmukhi: ੧੬ ਹਿੰਦੂ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਨਾਂ ਦੀ ਫਕੜ
translation: Fruitilty of Hindus and muslims

gurmukhi: ਲੋਕ ਵੇਦ ਸੁਣਿ ਅਾਖਦਾ ਸੁਣਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਗਿਅਾਨੀ ਗਿਅਾਨੁ ਵਖਾਣੈ
transliteration: Lok Vayd Souni Aakhadaa Souni Souni Giaanee Giaanu Vakhaanai.
translation: The so - called knowledgeable persons having listened to the Vedas as their knowledge about the world on the basis of hears

gurmukhi: ਸੁਰਗ ਲੋਕ ਸਣੁ ਮਾਤ ਲੋਕ ਸੁਣਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਸਾਤ ਪਤਾਲੁ ਨ ਜਾਣੈ
transliteration: Surag Lok Sanu Maat Lok Souni Souni Saat Pataalu Naa Jaanai.
translation: The  also learn about heavens, mother earth and all the seven odds, but still they donot know the real truth.

gurmukhi: ਭੂਤ ਭਵਿਖ ਨ ਵਰਤਮਾਨ ਅਾਦਿ ਮਧਿ ਅੰਤ ਹੋੲੇ ਹੈਰਾਣੈ
transliteration: Bhoot Bhavikh N Varatamaan Aadi Madhi Ant Hoay Hairaanai.
translation: Neither do they hand the past future and the present, nor the mystery of the beginning middle, but are simply wonderstruck

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤਮ ਮਧਮ ਨੀਚ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਮਝਿ ਨ ਸਕਣਿ ਚੋਜ ਵਿਡਾਣੈ
transliteration: Outam Madham Neech Hoi Samajhi N Sakani Choj Vidaanai.
translation: Through their classifications medium and low varnas they cannot understand the great play.

gurmukhi: ਰਜ ਗੁਣ ਤਮ ਗੁਣ ਅਾਖੀਅੈ ਸਤਿ ਗੁਣ ਸੁਣ ਅਾਖਾਣ ਵਖਾਣੈ
transliteration: Raj Goun Tam Goun Aakheeai Sati Goun Soun Aakhaan Vakhaanai.
translation: Engrossed in actions (rajoguni), inertia (tamoguni) and tranquillity (satoguni) also talk and listen,

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਬਚ ਕਰਮ ਸਿ ਭਰਮਦੇ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਨ ਸਿਞਞਞਞਾਣੈ
transliteration: Man Bach Karam Si Bharamaday Saadh Sangati Satigur N Siaanai.
translation: But without understanding the holy nation and the true Guru, they wander through the activities of their eech and actions.

gurmukhi: ਫਕੜ ਹਿੰਦੂ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਣੈ ||੧੬||
transliteration: Dhakarhu Hindoo Mousalamaanai ?16?
translation: Thus the (classifications of) Muslims and Hindus

gurmukhi: ੧੭ ਜੁੱਗਾਂ ਦੇ ਧਰਮ
translation: Duties of the yugs --the Time periods

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਜੁਗਿ ੲਿਕੁ ਵਿਗਾੜਦਾ ਤਿਸੁ ਪਿਛੈ ਫੜਿ ਦੇਸੁ ਪੀੜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Satijougi Iku Vigaarhadaa Tisu Pichhai Dharhi Daysu Peerhaaay.
translation: In the Satyug the whole country suffered because of the evil deeds of one wrong-doer.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰੇਤੈ ਨਗਰੀ ਵਗਲੀਅੈ ਦੁਅਾਪਰਿ ਵੰਸੁ ਨਰਕਿ ਸਹਮਾੲੇ
transliteration: Traytai Nagaree Vagaleeai Duaapari Vansu Naraki Sahamaaay.
translation: In Tretia the whole city was surrounded and in Dvapar, the whole family was to suffer hell.

gurmukhi: ਜੋ ਫੇੜੈ ਸੋ ਫੜੀਦਾ ਕਲਿਜੁਗ ਸਚਾ ਨਿਅਾੳੁ ਕਰਾੲੇ
transliteration: Jo Dhayrhai So Dharheedaa Kalijougi Sachaa Niaau Karaaay.
translation: The justice of Kaliyug is true because only he suffers who does the evil deeds.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਜੁਗ ਸਤੁ ਤ੍ਰੇਤੈ ਜੁਗਾ ਦੁਅਾਪਰਿ ਪੂਜਾ ਚਾਰਿ ਦਿੜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Satijoug Satu Traytai Jougaa Duaapari Poojaa Chaari Dirhaaay.
translation: In Satyug, the truth, in Treta- the yajti, in Dvapar ritualistic worship were accomplished.

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗਿ ਨਾੳੁ ਅਰਾਧਣਾ ਹੋਰ ਕਰਮ ਕਰਿ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਨ ਪਾੲੇ
transliteration: Kalijougi Naau Araadhanaa Hor Karam Kari Moukati N Paaay.
translation: In Kaliyug through no action other than constant remembering the Lord's name could attain liberation.

gurmukhi: ਜੁਗਿ ਜੁਗਿ ਲੁਣੀਅੈ ਬੀਜਿਅਾ ਪਾਪੁ ਪੁੰਨੁ ਕਰਿ ਦੁਖ ਸੁਖ ਪਾੲੇ
transliteration: Jougi Jougi Louneeai Beejiaa Paapu Pounnu Kari Doukh Soukh Paaay.
translation: In all the yugs (ages) the individual reaps what he has sown and earns sufferings and delights in accordance with his demer

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗਿ ਚਿਤਵੈ ਪੁੰਨ ਫਲ ਪਾਪਹੁ ਲੇਪੁ ਅਧਰਮੁ ਕਮਾੲੇ
transliteration: Kalijougi Chitavai Pounn Phal Paapahu Laypu Adharam Kamaaay.
translation: In Kaliyug, the individual desires to have the fruits of meritorious actions though he remains absorbed in the sinful deeds

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲੇ ||੧੭||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Aapu Gavaaay ?17?
translation: Gurmukhs attain the pleasure fruit only by losing their sense of ego

gurmukhi: ੧੮ ਧਰਮ ਧੳੁਲ ਦਾ ਅਲੰਕਾਰ
translation: Example of the Dharma Bull

gurmukhi: ਸਤਜੁਗ ਦਾ ਅਨਿਅਾੳੁ ਵੇਖਿ ਧੳੁਲ ਧਰਮ ਹੋਅਾ ੳੁਡੀਣਾ
transliteration: Satajoug Daa Aniaau Vaykhi Dhaul Dharamu Hoaa Udeenaa.
translation: Seeing the injustice of Satyug, dharma in the form of a bull got sad.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਰਪਤਿ ਨਰਪਤਿ ਚਕ੍ਵੈ ਰਖਿ ਨ ਹੰਘਨਿ ਬਲ ਮਤਿ ਹੀਣਾ
transliteration: Surapati Narapati Chakravai Rakhi N Hanghani Bal Mati Heenaa.
translation: Even the king of gods, Indr, and other kings with vast empires, engrossed egoism, devoid of power and wisdom could not sust

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰੇਤੇ ਖਿਸਿਅਾ ਪੈਰੁ ੲਿਕੁ ਹੋਮ ਜਗ ਜੁਗ ਥਾਪਿ ਪਤੀਣਾ
transliteration: Traytay Khisiaa Pairu Iku Hom Jag Jagu Daapi Pateenaa.
translation: In Treta- its one foot slipped and now religious people started feeling satisfied by mere performance of the ceremonies of

gurmukhi: ਦੁਅਾਪੁਰਿ ਦੁੲਿ ਪਗ ਧਰਮ ਦੇ ਪੂਜਾ ਚਾਰ ਪਖੰਡੁ ਅਲੀਣਾ
transliteration: Duaapuri Dui Pag Dharam Day Poojaa Chaar Pakhandu Aleenaa.
translation: In Dvapar remained only two feet of dharma and now people began to remain absorbed only ritualistic worship.

gurmukhi: ਕਲਿਜੁਗ ਰਹਿਅਾ ਪੈਰ ੲਿਕੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਨਿਮਾਣਾ ਧਰਮ ਅਧੀਣਾ
transliteration: Kalijoug Rahiaa Pair Iku Hoi Nimaanaa Dharam Adheenaa.
translation: In Kaliyug, the dharma has only one feet and consequently has become quite feeble.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਣੁ ਨਿਮਾਣੈ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਪਰਗਟ ਪਰਬੀਣਾ
transliteration: Maanu Nimaanai Satiguroo Saadhasangati Paragat Parabeenaa.
translation: True Guru, the power of the powerless, has made it (dharma) manifest by and through creating the holy Icongretgations.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਧਰਮ ਸਪੂਰਣੁ ਰੀਣਾ ||੧੮||
transliteration: Guramoukh Dharam Sapooranu Reenaa ?18?
translation: The gurmukhs have brought to perfection the dharma earlier reduced to dust.

gurmukhi: ੧੯ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਪੰਥ
translation: The gurmukh-wayfarer

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਵਰਨ ੲਿਕ ਵਰਨ ਕਰਿ ਵਰਨ ਅਵਰਨ ਸਾਧਸੰਗੁ ਜਾਪੈ
transliteration: Chaari Varani Ik Varani Kari Varan Avaran Saadhasangu Jaapai.
translation: Since the true Guru integrated all the four varnas into one, this assemblage of varnas has come to be known as the holy con

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਰੁਤੀ ਛਿਅ ਦਰਸਨਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਦਰਸਨੁ ਸੂਰਜੁ ਥਾਪੈ
transliteration: Chhia Routee Chhia Darasanaa Guramoukhi Darasanu Sooraju Daapai.
translation: Among six seasons and six philosophies, the Gurmukh-philosophy has been established like the Sun (among the planets).

gurmukhi: ਬਾਰਹ ਪੰਥ ਮਿਟਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥ ਵਡਾ ਪਰਤਾਪੈ
transliteration: Baarah Pand Mitaai Kai Guramoukhi Pand Vadaa Parataapai.
translation: Wiping out all the twelve ways (of yogis) the Guru has created the mighty Gurmukh-way (panth).

gurmukhi: ਵੇਦ ਕਤੇਬਹੁ ਬਾਹਰਾ ਅਨਹਦ ਸਬਦੁ ਅਗੰਮ ਅਲਾਪੈ
transliteration: Vayd Kataybahu Baaharaa Anahad Sabadu Aganm Alaapai.
translation: This panth keeps itself away from the boundaries of the Vedas and the Katebas and always remembers as well as sings the uns

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਪਾਖਾਕ ਹੋੲਿ ਗੁਰਸਿਖਾ ਰਹਰਾਸਿ ਪਛਾਪੈ
transliteration: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Gurasikhaa Raharaasi Pachhaapai.
translation: On this Way of absolute humility and becoming dust of the feet of the Gum, the disciple learns the right conduct.

gurmukhi: ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਵਿਚਿ ੳੁਦਾਸ ਕਰਿ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲੇ ਜਪੈ ਅਜਾਪੈ
transliteration: Maaiaa Vichi Udaasu Kari Aapu Gavaaay Japai Ajaapai.
translation: This panth remains detached amidst maya and obliterating the sense of ego remembers the Lord spontaneously i.e. always rema

gurmukhi: ਲੰਘ ਨਿਕਥੈ ਵਰੈ ਸਰਾਪੈ ||੧੯||
transliteration: Lagh Nikadai Varai Saraapai ?19?
translation: It has gone far beyond the influence of boons and curses.

gurmukhi: ੨੦ ਰਾਜਾ ਰੰਕ ਬਰਾਬਰ
translation: The King and the poor are equal

gurmukhi: ਮਿਲਦੇ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਨ ਦੁੲਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਕਰਨਿ ਸਲਾਮਾਲੇਕੀ
transliteration: Miladay Mousalamaan Dui Mili Mili Karani Salaamaalaykee.
translation: When two Muslims meet they greet each other by saying `Salam' (salamalaikum).

gurmukhi: ਜੋਗੀ ਕਰਨਿ ਅਦੇਸ ਮਿਲਿ ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਅਾਦੇਸੁ ਵਿਸੇਖੀ
transliteration: Jogee Karani Adays Mili Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Visaykhee.
translation: When yogis meet they exchange Wes" salute to that ,primaeval Lord.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਨਿਅਾਸੀ ਕਰਿ ਓਨਮੋ ਓਨਮ ਨਾਰਾੲਿਣ ਬਹੁ ਭੇਖੀ
transliteration: Sanniaasee Kari Aonamo Aonam Naaraain Bahu Bhaykhee.
translation: Sannyasis of different garbs say 'On namah', 'om namah narayanah'.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਮ੍ਹਣ ਨੋ ਕਰਿ ਨਮਸਕਾਰ ਕਰਿ ਅਾਸੀਰ ਵਚਨ ਮੁਹੁ ਦੇਖੀ
transliteration: Baamhan No Kari Namasakaar Kari Aaseer Vadan Muhu Daykhee.
translation: When one bows before a brahmin, he also in view of the station of the person gives blessings accordingly.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪਵਣਾ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖਾ ਰਹਰਾਸਿ ਸਰੇਖੀ
transliteration: Pairee Pavanaa Satiguroo Gur Sikhaa Raharaasi Saraykhee.
translation: Among the Sikhs, on meeting, the tradition of salulation by touching feet is there, and this is the best one.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜਾ ਰੰਕੁ ਬਰਾਬਰੀ ਬਾਲਕ ਬਿਰਧਿ ਨ ਭੇਦੁ ਨਿਮੇਖੀ
transliteration: Raajaa Ranku Baraabaree Baalak Biradhi N Bhaydu Nimaykhee.
translation: In this act the king and the poor are equal and no distinction of young and old is observed.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨ ਭਗਤਾ ਰੂਪ ਨ ਰੇਖੀ ||੨੦||
transliteration: Chandan Bhagataa Roop N Raykhee ?20?
translation: The devotees like sandal wood make no discrimination (while spreading their fragrance).

gurmukhi: ੨੧ ਨਿੰਮ੍ਰਤਾ ਦੇ ਦ੍ਰਿਸ਼ਟਾਂਤ
translation: Examples of humilty

gurmukhi: ਨੀਚਹੁ ਨੀਚੁ ਸਦਾਵਣਾ ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸੁ ਕਮਾਵੈ ਕੋੲੀ
transliteration: Neechahu Neechu Sadaavanaa Gur Oupadaysu Kamaavai Koee.
translation: Any rare one practises the Guru's teaching of calling oneself the lowest among the lowly ones.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰੈ ਵੀਹਾਂ ਦੇ ਦੰਮ ਲੈ ੲਿਕੁ ਰੁਪੲੀਅਾ ਹੋਛਾ ਹੋੲੀ
transliteration: Trai Veehaan Day Danm Lai Iku Roupaeeaa Hochhaa Hoee.
translation: When a rupee is changed into sixty paisas, its power is scattered and it becames weak.

gurmukhi: ਦਸੀ ਰੁਪਯੀਂ ਲੲੀਦਾ ੲਿਕੁ ਸੁਨੲੀਅਾ ਹੳੁਲਾ ਸੋੲੀ
transliteration: Dasee Roupayeen Laeedaa Iku Sounaeeaa Haulaa Soee.
translation: If gold-muhar (coin) is changed for ten rupees, it loses its value.

gurmukhi: ਸਹਸ ਸੁਨੲੀੲੇ ਮੁਲੁ ਕਰਿ ਲਯੈ ਹੀਰਾ ਹਾਰ ਪਰੋੲੀ
transliteration: Sahas Sounaeeay Mulu Kari Layai Heeraa Haar Paroee.
translation: And if a diamond is obtained for one thousand coins, it becomes so light that it is stringed in a necklace (and is worn).

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਪਾਖਾਕ ਹੋੲਿ ਮਨ ਬਚ ਕਰਮ ਭਰਮ ਭੳੁ ਖੋੲੀ
transliteration: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Man Bach Karam Bharam Bhau Khoee.
translation: The man who by touching the feet and by becoming dust of the feet (of Guru) erases the illusions and fears of speech

gurmukhi: ਹੋੲਿ ਪੰਚਾੲਿਣੁ ਪੰਜਿ ਮਾਰ ਬਾਹਰਿ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਰਖਿ ਸਗੋੲੀ
transliteration: Hoi Panchaainu Panji Maar Baahari Jaadaa Rakhi Sagoee.
translation: And actions from his mind and in the holy congregation wipes out the five evil propensities, he further restrains the mind

gurmukhi: ਬੋਲ ਅਬੋਲੁ ਸਾਧ ਜਨ ਓੲੀ ||੨੧||੨੩||
transliteration: Bol Abolu Saadh Jan Aoee ?21?23?trayee?
translation: Such a one is a real sadhu (Gurmukh) and his words are ineffable.

gurmukhi: ਦਰਸਨ ਜੋਤਿ ਨ ਜੋਤੀ ਸਰੂਪ ਹੁੲਿ ਪਤੰਗ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਮ੍ਰਿਗ ਜੁਗਤਿ ਨ ਜਾਨੀ ਹੈ
transliteration: Darasan Joti N Jotee Saroop Hui Patanga , Sabad Surati Mrig Jougati N Jaanee Hai ?
translation: Like a moth, I do not sacrifice myself over the radiant glimpse True Guru, nor do I know the method of lodging the music of True Guru's words as is the wont of a deer;

gurmukhi: ਚਰਨ ਕਮਲ ਮਕਰੰਦ ਨ ਮਧੁਪ ਗਤਿ ਬਿਰਹ ਬਿਓਗ ਹੁੲਿ ਨ ਮੀਨ ਮਰਿ ਜਾਨੈ ਹੈ
transliteration: Charan Kamal Makarand N Madhoup Gati , Birah Biaog Hui N Meen Mari Jaanai Hai ?
translation: Like a bumble bee mad for the nectar of lotus flower loses his life when the flower closes, but I have not sacrificed myself unto the lotus like feet of my Satguru, nor have Known the pangs of separation from my Satguru like a fish when out of water;

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕ ੲੇਕ ਟੇਕ ਨ ਟਰਤ ਹੈ ਤ੍ਰਿਗਦ ਜੋਨਿ ਚਾਤੁਰ ਚਤਰ ਗੁਨ ਹੋੲਿ ਨ ਹਿਰਾਨੈ ਹੈ
transliteration: Ayk Ayk Tayk N Tarat Hai Trigad Joni , Chaatur Chatar Goun Hoi N Hiraanai Hai ?
translation: The living being of lower species do not backtrack their steps dying for their love that is based on just one virtue. But I with all my wisdom do not carry any trait like these beings, I do not sacrifice myself unto my True Guru creatures do;

gurmukhi: ਪਾਹਨ ਕਠੋਰ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸੁਖ ਸਾਗਰ ਮੈ ਸੁਨਿ ਮਮ ਨਾਮ ਜਮ ਨਰਕ ਲਜਾਨੈ ਹੈ ||੨੩||
transliteration: Paahan Katthor Satigur Soukh Saagar Mai , Souni Mam Naam Jam Narak Lajaanai Hai ?23?
translation: Satguru is ocean of peace and tranquillity but I am like a stone (who is least influenced by any precept of the True Guru) despite living near Him. Hearing the name of a sinner like the messenger of hell would feel ashamed of me. (23)
